str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Or ekchuno ek-khoo'-no from ek and cheo; to pour forth; figuratively, to bestow.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Wind, breath, spirit.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
And, even, also, namely.
Apparently a primary word; a female child, or descendant.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From prophetes; to foretell events, divine, speak under inspiration, exercise the prophetic office.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A young man, youth, an attendant. From the same as neanias; a youth.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
A sight, vision, appearance. From horao; the act of gazing, i.e. an aspect or an inspired appearance.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To dream (see visions) in my sleep. Middle voice from enupnion; to dream.
A dream, vision. From en and hupnos; something seen in sleep, i.e. A dream.
